meanings.definition: Of or relating to scribes or their work.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll had intricate scribal markings.
meanings.sent2: The library contained many scribal documents.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the scribal ink pot, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so neat, it was almost scribal in its precision.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was filled with the scent of old scribal parchment.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or resembling the work of a scribe.
meanings.sent1: The calligraphy on the wedding invitation was beautifully scribal.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of scribal tools.
meanings.sent3: The scribal quill danced across the paper, leaving elegant strokes.
meanings.sent4: His attention to detail was so precise, it was almost scribal in nature.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes had a scribal quality to them.
